Not sure how to formulate this question, but is there anyone from HS's team that works with the reporting over there that i can bounce some questions off of?

Hey, a couple months ago I asked about submitting non-HubSpot forms to HubSpot using AJAX, and some folks in here helped me get that working. Apparently, those requests are now triggering an Access-Control-Allow-Origin error, which is breaking them, and I know they were working before. Did something change, and is there a way around it or a way to fix it on HubSpot's end? <https://jsfiddle.net/3xh4eq4z/> This is the demo that <@U25PYL3Q8> made, which shows what I'm talking about.

Hello all, Sneaking in to this discussion... I am hoping to get some help with a question from my lead email designer that she has NEVER asked before. For email sent from HubSpot are we able to adjust font sizes on mobile? And if so, can you provide some direction that a non-dev relatively comfortable in the source code can execute? Thanks in advance!
you would want to use a media query for changing it on mobile devices
Thanks, that was the start I needed.
I got one filled out today, but since then I haven't seen anymore. I'm wondering if there is some sort of intermittent issue??!!
So I just received soemthing from <@U5BGUA4BX>
so it seems to be working again?

Ah, that’s strange - I had sent that through so I could check out the HTTP headers that are getting returned. I received the Access-Control-Allow-Origin error, then got distracted and forgot to keep digging. But I just re-sent and noticed that the Access-Control-Allow-Origin error in the console isn’t an actual 401 or 404 response error. Checking out the Network tab, the POST request still has a 204 status
Yeah, I noticed that too
So working, just throwing an error?  that seems odd
